name: Anna FAUST, Appellant, v. Joseph L. MESSINGER, Thomas Snyder & R. Benay Snyder, Appellees

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON and ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
parties: Anna FAUST, Appellant, v. Joseph L. MESSINGER, Thomas Snyder & R. Benay Snyder, Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Dwight L. Danser, Easton, for appellant.
Joel M. Scheer, Easton, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
523 A.2d 741
Anna FAUST, Appellant, v. Joseph L. MESSINGER, Thomas Snyder & R. Benay Snyder, Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 23, 1986.
Decided April 3, 1987.
Dwight L. Danser, Easton, for appellant.
Joel M. Scheer, Easton, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON and ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
